1. This sign means:
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column2: 2. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
3. When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
4. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 5. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.
column6: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.
column8: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.

column2: 6. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.
column10: slow down at the traffic signal.

column2: 7. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
8. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead is closed to traffic

column2: 9. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you should:
column4: slow down, provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.
column6: immediately come to a complete stop.
column8: disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
column10: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.

column2: 10. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: When it has just begun to rain.
column6: If it's been raining several hours.
column8: When it's been raining from at least one hour.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
12. This road sign means:
column6: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column8: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column10: Always come to a complete stop

column2: 13. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column4: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 14. When passing a pedestrian who is walking on the road and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
column4: honk your horn to warn the pedestrian.
column6: keep driving, you have the right-of-way.
column8: slow down and let the vehicle pass first.

column2: 15. What does this sign indicate?
16. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column8: be ready to shift to lower gear.

column2: 17. A flashing yellow light:
column4: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 18. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
19. No Zones are areas around trucks where cars:
column4: disappear into blind spots or are so close to the truck that the driver's ability to stop or maneuver safely is restricted.
column6: can travel behind trucks at constant speed and have no risks of being involved in a collision.
column8: can turn safely because several car lengths have been left between the truck and car.

column2: 20. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column10: honk to let them know you’re there.

column2: 21. You are driving on a four-lane divided highway, two vehicles are driving side by side ahead of you, and you are in a hurry. You should:
column4: drive closely behind the vehicle in the right lane.
column6: drive in either lane with at least a two-second time interval behind the vehicle ahead.
column8: drive closely behind the vehicle in the left lane and flash your headlights.
column10: drive closely behind the vehicles ahead changing lanes frequently.

column2: 22. This sign means:
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
